data.title: DynamicVertexBuffer.ContentLost Event Is Missing
data.body:
Looks like we're missing the DynamicVertexBuffer.ContentLost event.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.dynamicvertexbuffer.contentlost(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx

data.title: Fixed SpriteFont DrawInto bug
data.body:
This fixes a `SpriteFont.DrawInto` bug related to `firstGlyphOfLine`. In an attempt to make sure lines don't start with negative bearing, the initial `offset.X` was incorrectly always set to 0 (`offset.X==0` for firstGlyphOfLine), which is not in sync with XNA behavior. It's true that the _minimum_ initial offset should be 0, but it's not true that the _maximum_ initial offset should be 0. If the first glyph of a line starts with positive LeftSideBearing, then that should be added to the start of the line.

Pretty much any monospaced bitmap/pixel font provides a good test case, e.g., [Namco's Classic Arcade Font](https://www.google.com/search?q=namco+classic+arcade+font&tbm=isch). Notice how the shorter "T" character in "THE" is incorrectly flush with the left side of the line in the [top half of this image](http://i.imgur.com/Ilp3lrC.png) (pre-bug fix) causing the letters to fall out of alignment later on in the line, but the "T" characters are correctly offset by their left side bearing in the bottom half (post-bug fix) which keeps everything in alignment (and in sync with XNA behavior).

data.title: Unescape import project paths, clear readonly flag on copy items.
>32bpp Image Fix
data.body: FreeImage.GetBitmap doesn't support images above 32bpp. Input textures are now converted to 32bpp if they already aren't.

data.title: TouchPanelCapabilities (IsConnected, MaximumTouchCount) for all platforms
data.body:
I've implemented figuring out the TouchPanelCapabilities for each platform.
At the moment they are all #if'd in to the file, happy to tidy this up if you can suggest how :)

TouchCollection.IsConnected is also correctly implemented now, it is set based on the capabilities, rather than always saying true.

Fixes #2531
Fixes #2532
Improves Mono-Game/MonoGame.Samples#15

data.title: Correctly set TouchCollection.IsConnected
data.body:
based on TouchPanelCapabilities.IsConnected (not that that is correct yet).

Fixes #2531

data.title: TouchPanelCapabilities.IsConnected/MaximumTouchCount only set for WINDOWS_STOREAPP
data.body:
Every other platform just says there is a touch panel and it has 8 touch points.

Looks like we should refactor to push this in to the platform class maybe (Or add more `#elseif` statements).

FYI, to work out touches count on windows:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2375105/net-4-determine-the-number-of-touch-points-available-in-win-7
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-nz/library/windows/desktop/ms724385(v=vs.85).aspx
"Nonzero if there are digitizers in the system; otherwise, 0."
(This took me a lot of searching!)

data.title: TouchPanelCollection.IsConnected always true
data.body:
As returned by TouchPanel.GetState()

This should be coming from TouchPanelCapabilities.IsConnected, but it is just hardwired to true.
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Input/Touch/TouchCollection.cs#L77

I'll take a look at this, logging so I don't forget.

data.title: MonoDevelop addin doesn't work
data.body:
I can't get the project templates working, here's the steps I took:
1. Built MonoDevelop.MonoGame.Linux project from MonoDevelop.MonoGame.sln from monogame 3.2 (stable release) successfully.
2. Placed resulting files (icons dir, templates dir, MonoDevelop.MonoGame.dll) into ~/.local/share/MonoDevelop-4.0/LocalInstall/Addins/MonoDevelop.MonoGame/
3. Restarted MonoDevelop. No new solution templates are available, also, nothing new is in the addin manager.
4. Moved MonoDevelop.MonoGame directory into /usr/lib/monogame/
5. Restarted MonoDevelop. Still not working.
6. Repeated steps for monogame's develop branch. with same result.

I'm using MonoDevelop 4.2.2 on Ubuntu 13.10.

data.title: Resuming Application Crashes Device Android 4.2.2
data.body:
Hi,

I am getting the following exception when trying to resume a paused app on an HTC One X running Android 4.2.2 - app is built with Xamarin Android 4.12.

I notice in Xamarin Android 4.12 there is a reference to changing the way App Resume works in OpenTK though I've no idea whether this has anything to do with it.

The 'game' is just a simple app that draws two textures to screen. The exception happens every time I try a pause/resume.

cheers

data.title: Cannot compile Windows SharpDX Version
data.body: Because VideoSampleGrabber inherits from two base classes: : SharpDX.CallbackBase, SampleGrabberSinkCallback

data.title: MGFX hashCode
data.body:
_MGFX_
Write a hash code of the shader/effect in the  Header.

File version up to 6 from 5 because the header has changed. I had to
make room for 4 more bytes.

Everything after the header (ConstantBuffers/Shaders/etc) has to be
written into a Memory Stream.
We then calculate a hash from this memory stream and write it to the
header. at the end the memory stream is written into the final stream.
This makes it possible to accept a non seekable stream (network?) but
uses more memory.
The alternative would be to store the position, write a null value,
write the rest of the file and seek back to update the hash value.

*MonoGame.Framework/Utilities/Hash.cs *
A modified version of Hash.ComputeHash() that accept streams. 
This is only needed if we are going to support MGFX version 5 files.

_MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Effect/Effect.cs_
Group header variables into a single struct (MGFXHeader).

Move code that reads the header from ReadEffect() into the new method
ReadHeader.

We now have to read the header every time inside the constructor.
(It seems that MemoryStream that's created from a byte array doesn't
involve memcopy but use the array directly...)

Note: There is a platform (PSM, PlayStation Mobile?) that seems to handle things differently.  
Probably I broke something there, because the code that reads  the header has been moved from ReadEffect to the constructor.

data.title: Building a spritefont crashes MonoDevelop
data.body:
If I do the following steps with the content pipeline addin, MonoDevelop crashes.
- Create a MonoGame Content Project
- Create a spritefont file (using the wizard thing)
- Set the FontName node to the name of a ttf file
- Build project

I'd like to add, if the FontName isn't valid (and therefore building gives an error), or if there's no spritefiles. MonoDevelop doesn't crash on build.

I'm using MonoDevelop 4.0.12 on Ubuntu 13.10.

data.title: Design Documentation Outline
data.body:
We need to come up with a high level outline of what we want to include in the "user manual", the non-reference part of the [MonoGame documentation hub](http://www.monogame.net/documentation/).

My initial rough outline:
- Introduction
  - What is MonoGame
  - System Requirements
  - Setting Up MonoGame
  - MonoGame FAQ
  - Help & Support
- Getting Started
  - The Basics
  - Creating Your First Game
  - Cross-Platform Games
- Coding Your Game
  - The Game Loop
  - Loading Content
  - Rendering The Scene
    - SpriteBatch
    - DrawPrimitive
    - Using Effects
  - Handling User Input
  - Playing Sound Effects
  - Playing Music
- Adding Art, Sounds, Music, Etc.
  - What is Game Content
  - The Pipeline Tool
  - Custom Effects
  - Custom Content Types
- Distributing Your Game
- Tools
  - 2MGFX
  - MGCB
- Credits
- Copyrights

Of course each of these sections would need subsections dealing with platform specific issues along with the common information.

Note the goal here is to replace the need to depend on the Microsoft XNA documentation and hopefully improve upon what they provided.

data.title: Implement game tick for Web platform
data.body:
This hooks up the game's update and render loop for the Web platform, using
window.setTimeout to drive the loop behaviour.

Currently it always renders red when the graphics device is cleared, but this
is temporary.

data.title: Documentation Style Fixes
data.body:
This PR improves the SharpDoc "MonoGame" style to make the documentation feel like it is part of the MonoGame.net website.
- Removed header.
- Removed footer.
- Removed scrollbars from inner `<iframe>`.

After that I used a dynamically resizing `<iframe>` to embed the docs within our Wordpress theme.  This will make it very easy to automatically update the docs from the build server in the future.

It looks pretty great IMO...

  http://www.monogame.net/documentation/

I still want to improve the style more moving forward:
- Scroll to top of page when switching content.
- Full URLs to content for easy sharing.
- Remove C++ syntax tabs.
- Figure out what to do for mobile.

This is all part of the big documentation project https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2378.

data.title: Hook up Javascript implementations to JSAPI class
Resumer improvement
data.body:
Hi!

this tries to implement https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2463

data.title: MacOS platform Uses GamerServices in MacGamePlatform.cs
data.body:
Whilst doing the NET separation I came across a reference to the .GamerServices namespace in MacGamePlatform.cs

On line 272 & 264 it checks:
if (AreUpdatingAndDrawingSuspended || IsPlayingVideo) || Guide.isVisible)

This isn't done on any other platform.

It has been commented out as part of the .NET work, can this be investigated to ensure it is not needed.

data.title: Separation project for the NET and GamerServices namespaces
data.body:
All .NET and .GamerServices files and references moved to new .NET libraries for all platforms

Fully tested on all platforms
Issues logged for code comments:
- #2510 Android platform calls Net.Session.Exit in AndroidGamePlatform.cs
- #2511 OpenTKGamePlatform has been updated and calls Net.Session.Exit
- #2512 iOS platform calls Guide.Initialise in iOSGamePlatform.cs
- #2513 PSM platform calls Net.Session.Exit in PSSGamePlatform.cs
- #2515 MacOS platform Uses GamerServices in MacGamePlatform.cs

.gitignore updated to ignore the new .NET .csproj files
GUID generated for new projects

Took slightly longer than anticipated as some recent PR's must have added new items.  
Windows Phone is a concern because there is no Lidgren library for Windows Phone in third Party libs, so NET domain excluded and come of GamerServices that depend on NET.
There was a lot of tidy up with WindowsPhone as most GamerServices files were excluded for some unexplained reason, considered dropping NET dll from phone completely.  Instead it has most of the lib except NET for now.  Will need revisiting.

data.title: PSM platform calls Net.Session.Exit in PSSGamePlatform.cs
data.body:
Whilst doing the NET separation I came across a reference to the .NET namespace in PSSGamePlatform.cs

On line 105/106 it calls:
Net.NetworkSession.Exit();

This isn't done on any other platform except Android and Angle

It has been commented out as part of the .NET work, can this be investigated to ensure it is not needed.

data.title: iOS platform calls Guide.Initialise in iOSGamePlatform.cs
data.body:
Whilst doing the NET separation I came across a reference to the .GamerServices namespace in iOSGamePlatform.cs

On line 124/125 it calls:
Guide.Initialise(game);

This isn't done on any other platform.

It has been commented out as part of the .NET work, can this be investigated to ensure it is not needed.

data.title: OpenTKGamePlatform has been updated and calls Net.Session.Exit
data.body:
Whilst doing the NET separation I came across a reference to the .NET namespace in OpenTKGamePlatform.cs

On line 158/159 it calls:
Net.NetworkSession.Exit();

This wasn't done on any other platform apart from Android and this was added very recently. 

It has been commented out as part of the .NET work, can this be investigated to ensure it is not needed.

data.title: Android platform calls Net.Session.Exit in AndroidGamePlatform.cs
data.body:
Whilst doing the NET separation I came across a reference to the .NET namespace in AndroidGamePlatform.cs

On line 42/43 it calls:
    Net.NetworkSession.Exit();

This isn't done on any other platform.  
It has been commented out as part of the .NET work, can this be investigated to ensure it is not needed.
